H0.text: Submission of an article to a peerâ€‘reviewed journal is the first means by which a scientist should communicate results suggesting a new explanation for the digestion of certain proteins in humans to the scientific community.

H1.text: Inclusion of the new explanation in a biology textbook is the first means by which a scientist should communicate results from an experiment that suggests a new explanation for the digestion of certain proteins in humans to the scientific community.

H2.text: Posting observations and conclusions on the scientist's website is the first way the scientist should communicate results of an experiment that suggests a new explanation for the digestion of certain proteins in humans to the scientific community.

H3.text: Inviting reporters from many organizations to a press conference is the way a scientist should first communicate the results of an experiment that suggests a new explanation for the digestion of certain proteins in humans to the scientific community.

A4.text: Peer review is the evaluation of work by one or more people with similar competencies as the producers of the work (peers). It functions as a form of self-regulation by qualified members of a profession within the relevant field.

A5.text: Peer review methods are used to maintain quality standards, improve performance, and provide credibility.
